result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:57 am - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David R. Berger in court.  Attorney Carl Knepel appeared by video for David R. Berger. Not guilty plea.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of criminal damage to property (DVO) and disorderly conduct (DVO).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-21-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $350.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no assaultive contact with M.O.B. 9-22-1947 and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
